alerts.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Farmington River at Simsbury.

* WHEN...Until late tonight.

* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding affects Old Farms and Tolliston
Roads in Avon, Meadow Road in Farmington, and Nod, Riverside, and
Terrys Plain Roads in Simsbury. Route 315 in Simsbury is also
impacted. Flooding spreads into Plantation Country Club and
adjoining Town Farm Road in Simsbury. Also, flooding will approach
the Paine Boathouse.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 3:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 14.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 3:30 AM EDT Sunday was 14.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
late this evening and continue falling to 6.1 feet early
Tuesday afternoon.
- Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
13.8 feet on 04/01/2010.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.title: Flood Warning issued October 1 at 4:26AM EDT until October 2 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Boston/Norton MA

alerts.description:
Clearing skies and a wet ground resulted in areas of fog across
portions of northern Connecticut and central and western
Massachusetts. Visibility may be reduced to one quarter mile at
times, especially in the river valleys.

If traveling this morning, be prepared for very low visibility in
spots and variable conditions. The fog should start to dissipate
shortly after sunrise.
alerts.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 1 at 1:03AM EDT by NWS Boston/Norton MA
